title: NASA’s “Severely Underfunded” Biological and Physical Sciences Research Program Needs Tenfold Increase
summary: Grand plans for long-term human exploration of space require extensive research into how humans adapt to the space environment and that means increased funding for biological and physical sciences research […]

title: Kuiper launch companies say they can meet Amazon’s schedule
summary: The three companies with multibillion-dollar contracts to launch Amazons’s Project Kuiper constellation say they are committed to deploying those satellites on schedule despite delays in the development of their vehicles.

title: Space Force to create “integrated” units responsible for acquisition, maintenance and operations
summary: Gen. Chance Saltzman announced the Space Force will experiment with a new command structure where a unit is responsible for all aspects of a mission area, including training, procurement and operations.

title: Phase Four demonstrates Maxwell Block 2 thruster in orbit
summary: Phase Four’s Maxwell Block 2 radio-frequency thruster has been demonstrated on a commercial satellite.

title: Intelsat plotting a MEO constellation in 2027 with C-band windfall
summary: Intelsat expects to decide whether to proceed with plans for a medium Earth orbit constellation early next year after requesting proposals from nine satellite makers, an executive for the geostationary fleet operator said Sept. 12.

title: Axiom Space Announces International Crew Of Axiom 3 Mission
summary: This morning, NASA and its international partners cleared the crew of 4 who will fly aboard Crew Dragon early next year as part of the Axiom 3 mission, operated by Axiom Space.

title: NASA Sets Coverage for Launch, Docking of New Space Station Crew
summary: A NASA astronaut and two Roscosmos cosmonauts are set to launch to the International Space Station on Friday, Sept. 15. The U.S. space agency will provide full coverage of launch and crew’s arrival at the microgravity laboratory.

title: NASA, Partners Clear Axiom Space’s Third Private Astronaut Crew
summary: NASA and its international partners approved the crew for Axiom Space’s third private astronaut mission to the International Space Station, launching from the agency’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida no earlier than January 2024.

title: NASA Receives Decadal Survey on Biological, Physical Sciences Research
summary: A new study report may help NASA define and align biological and physical sciences research to uniquely advance scientific knowledge, meet human and robotic exploration mission needs, and provide benefits for all over the next decade.

title: NeuraSpace platform assets jump tenfold
summary: In six months, Portuguese startup NeuraSpace has gone from 25 to 250 satellites on its space traffic management platform.
